target.text: Creating a Custom Entry

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Creating the Custom Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Teaming Administration portlet on the initial Liferay portal window, click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form and view designers to expand this section and view the available designers. To add the Teaming Administration portlet to the Liferay portal window, click the Add Content link in the upper right corner. This brings up a panel of portlets along the left margin. Expand the Teaming section to add more Novell Teaming features, such as the Teaming Administration portlet.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Entry designer.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Designers window that appears, click Entry definitions.

target.name: Step
target.text: On the right side of the window, click Add a new entry definition.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Caption field, type the name for the entry that you want to see in Novell Teaming.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Name field, type the name for this entry type.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the family for this entry from the Family list box.

target.name: Step
target.text: From the Allowed comment types list box, select the comment types you want to allow for this new custom entry (use the Ctrl key to select multiple comment types).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK at the bottom of the entry form.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Creating a Custom Form for an Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Click the plus sign (+) to the left of Entry form definition to expand this section.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the plus sign (+) to the left of Entry form definition to expand this section.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the plus sign (+) to the left of Form to expand this section and view the current elements in this form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Delete an element:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click the element (Description).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the element (Description).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog that appears to the right, click the Delete option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK to confirm that you want to delete the Description element.

target.name: Step
target.text: Hide an element from appearing in the form view:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click the element you want to hide (such as Attachments).

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the element you want to hide (such as Attachments).

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Modify.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the Attachments element form that appears, select the Hide this form element option.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add an element:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click Form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Form.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Event to add the Event element for entering the time off as an event with a start and end time.

target.name: Step
target.text: Fill in the Event element form.

target.name: Step
target.text: (Optional) Move an element:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click the Time Off Dates and Time element.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the Time Off Dates and Time element.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Move.

target.name: Step
target.text: If you want this element to appear below another element, click the element under Form that you want this element to appear under (Title).

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Move to below the selected item option and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add a required Text element named Total Hours Off and move it below the Time Off Dates and Time element.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add a required Text element named Reason for Time Off and move it to below the Title element.

target.name: Step
target.text: Add a container:

target.name: SubSteps
target.text: Click Form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Form.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Add.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Box.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Square with border and click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Time Off Dates and Time.

target.name: Step
target.text: In the options dialog, click Move.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Box.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select Move into the selected item and click OK.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Creating a Custom View for an Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Expand Entry view definition.

target.name: Step
target.text: Expand Entry view definition.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select and delete the Description and Attachments elements.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Entry view definition, click Add in the option dialog, and click Time Off Dates and Time.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click Add in the option dialog, click Reason for Time Off, then click OK.

target.name: Step
target.text: Move the Reason for Time Off element to below the Entry creator and creation date element, and move the Time Off Dates and Time element to below the Reason for Time Off element.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: Configuring a Folder to Use Your Custom Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Find the folder you want to use for the team's Time Off entries (Engineering > Time Off Entries for this example procedure).

target.name: Step
target.text: Find the folder you want to use for the team's Time Off entries (Engineering > Time Off Entries for this example procedure).

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the Manage > Configure menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Allowed Views, select the Discussion folder viewed as a table and Discussion folder viewed as a list options, deselect any others, then click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Default view, select the Discussion folder viewed as a list option and click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: Under Default entry types, select the Time Off entry type (deselect any others) and click Apply.

target.name: Step
target.text: At the top or bottom of this window, click Close.

target.text: Adding a Time Off Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Select the New > Time Off menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Select the New > Time Off menu item.

target.name: Step
target.text: Fill out the Time Off entry form.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click OK.

target.name: Sect2
target.text: View the Time Off Entry

target.name: Procedure
target.text: Click the title of the Time Off entry you want to view.

target.name: Step
target.text: Click the title of the Time Off entry you want to view.

target.name: Step
target.text: View the entry. You can see that it displays the elements selected for this custom view.
